Bremen Athletics
March 3, 2015 at 2:58 PM ·

Bremen's Dylan Shumaker has recently been named recipient of the 2015 Thomas A. Brady Comeback Scholarship Award. Dylan is one of two Indiana high school students to receive this prestigious honor and $1,000 scholarship. He will be recognized during an awards dinner sponsored by Methodist Sports Medicine in Indianapolis on April 16th. Guest speakers during the presentation will be Lou Holtz and Quinn Buckner. Award winners must have overcome adversity or injury that affected their ability to participate in a IHSAA sport, returned to their respective sport, demonstrated good sportsmanship and ethical behavior and also be in good academic standing. Dylan was unable to participate in sports during his sophomore year while being treated for spinal cord cancer. As a senior, Dylan qualified for the wrestling regional and finished the year with a record of 29-10. Congratulations Dylan!

post_text: Wow! What a successful weekend for the Boys' Swim Team. Congrats gentlemen!
shared_text:
Bremen Senior High School
February 23, 2015 at 9:41 AM ·

Congratulations to the Boys' Swim Team on their success at the South Bend Riley Sectional! Here are some of the highlights from this past weekend!

- Overall, the team placed 4th. They beat New Prairie, Mishawaka Marian, Mishawaka, SB Clay, SB Adams, and SB Washington.
- Krent Hueni won the 200 yard freestyle. He also set a new school record in the 500 freestyle.
- Will Serf won the 100 yard freestyle. He also set a new school record in the backstroke.
- Nolan Filchak shattered the school record in the 200 yard medley by just over 3.5 seconds.
- The 400 yard relay team of Krent Hueni, Nolan Filchak, Will Serf, and Carter Filchak finished 2nd, giving them the chance to compete again in the state finals.
- Beau Beeson qualified for the Mishawaka Diving Regional with his 4th place finish. He will compete again at 6pm Tuesday, February 24th.

Along with the boys' success, BHS Swim Coach Meredith Eakins was voted "Sectional Swim Coach of the Year."

Congratulations on your outstanding season! Best of luck next weekend in Indianapolis!
